Class CustomBalloonTip

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container

                  net.java.balloontip.BalloonTip
                      net.java.balloontip.CustomBalloonTip
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible
Direct Known Subclasses:
TablecellBalloonTip
public class CustomBalloonTip
extends BalloonTip

Provides the same functionality as a BalloonTip, but you can add a certain offset, which can come in handy if attached to custom components. Also, if the attached component is part of a JScrollPane, the balloon tip can be set such that it will only be visible if the chosen offset point is visible.

Author:
Tim Molderez
See Also:
Serialized Form

offset

protected java.awt.Rectangle offset
Constructor Detail

CustomBalloonTip

public CustomBalloonTip(javax.swing.JComponent attachedComponent,
                        java.lang.String text,
                        java.awt.Rectangle offset,
                        BalloonTipStyle style,
                        BalloonTip.Orientation alignment,
                        BalloonTip.AttachLocation attachLocation,
                        int horizontalOffset,
                        int verticalOffset,
                        boolean useCloseButton)
Parameters:
attachedComponent - The custom component to attach the balloon tip to
offset - Specifies a rectangle within the attached component; the balloon tip will attach to this rectangle. Do note that the coordinates should be relative to the attached component's top left corner.
See Also:
BalloonTip.BalloonTip(JComponent, String, BalloonTipStyle, Orientation, AttachLocation, int, int, boolean)

                        BalloonTipPositioner positioner,
                        boolean useCloseButton)
Parameters:
attachedComponent - The custom component to attach the balloon tip to
offset - Specifies a rectangle within the attached component; the balloon tip will attach to this rectangle. Do note that the coordinates should be relative to the attached component's top left corner.
See Also:
BalloonTip.BalloonTip(JComponent, String, BalloonTipStyle, BalloonTipPositioner, boolean)

setOffset

Set the offset within the attached component

Parameters:
offset -

closeBalloon

public void closeBalloon()
Description copied from class: BalloonTip
If you want to permanently close the balloon, use this method. (If you just need to hide the balloon, use setVisible(false);) You cannot use this BalloonTip-instance anymore after calling this method!

Overrides:
closeBalloon in class BalloonTip

setViewport

public void setViewport(javax.swing.JViewport viewport)
Sets up the balloon tip such that it will only be shown if the table cell we're attached to is visible within this viewport. This is very useful if, for example, the JTable with this balloon tip is inside a JScrollpane. (You can also remove the viewport by calling setViewport(null).)

Parameters:
viewport -

getViewport

public javax.swing.JViewport getViewport()
Retrieve the viewport that this balloon tip is monitoring, such that the balloon tip will hide itself once the balloon's tip is outside of this viewport.

Returns:
The viewport this balloon tip is located in

refreshLocation
